title: Simulation-Based Language Teacher Training for Interactions Between Science Education and Emotional Experiences

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science education theory and practical classroom experience, basic understanding of emotional expression and communication strategies in language education
context.additional_context: A collaborative learning structure analyzing learners' emotional responses in VR simulation environments and sharing experiences through reflective interviews. Particularly focuses on improving expressive and reading comprehension skills in integrated science-language education.

learning_goals: Participants can explain six types of emotional interactions occurring in science classes (Self-sustained, Beyond expectation, Resonant, Adversely Overpowered, Below expectation, Irresponsive) through linguistic expressions linked to real-world cases
Participants observe learners' emotional responses using VR simulation tools and apply methods to incorporate these observations into language lesson design.
Participants improve emotion-centered science education strategies for language learning contexts by sharing experiences with peer teachers through reflective interview techniques.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
